thread.title: Trip of the week | Northern Lights Holidays
thread.title_full: Trip of the week | Northern Lights Holidays

title: Trip of the week | Northern Lights Holidays
text:
By Cindy Decker Dispatch • Sunday October 18, 2015 5:00 AM 
Each week, Travel Editor Cindy Decker highlights an interesting travel package sent to her inbox. 
Northern Lights Holidays 
OFF THE MAP TRAVEL, 44(0)800-566-8901, www.ILoveNorthernLights.com 
THE TRIP: Guests will visit the Arctic region of northern Sweden, stay overnight in insulated ice-fishing huts on the banks of a frozen lake, and see the aurora borealis. 
The “Aurora Village” is set along Lake Badsjon in the Bjorkliden and Abisko region of Sweden where light pollution is at a minimum. 
The site offers unlimited sky views. 
The fishing huts are reached by snowmobile or snowshoe from a base in Bjorkliden. The trip is appropriate for all ages and abilities. 
The trip also includes a three-night stay in a four-star hotel, all meals, a “Lights Over Lapland” photography trip, dogsledding and snowmobiling for two adults. 
THE COST: From $2,150 per person, double occupancy
